column187: Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 (a) of FA | Description :Subsidiary Agreement has been executed on behalf of the Recipient and theProject Implementation Entity. | Due Date :10-Oct-2011,Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 (b) | Description :Project Implementation Manual and Manual of Procedures have been adapted for theProject. | Due Date :10-Oct-2011,Finance Agreement :Section I A.5 of Schedule 2 | Description :No later than 3 months after effectiveness\, the Recipient hasrecruited a financial management specialist for the Project. | Due Date :10-Jan-2012,Finance Agreement :Section II B.4 of Schedule 2 | Description :To ensure timely carrying out of audits\, the Recipient shall engageauditors no later than 6 months after effectiveness. | Due Date :29-Feb-2012,Finance Agreement :Section II B.5 of Schedule 2 | Description :No later than 3 months after effectiveness\, the Recipient shallensure that the PCU's accounting software has been adapted for the Project. | Due Date :10-Jan-2012,Finance Agreement :Section IV B.1 (b) of Schedule 2 | Description :No withdrawal shall be made under category 2 until the serviceagreement has been entered into. | Due Date :10-Jan-2012,Finance Agreement :Section V (a) of Schedule 2 | Description :The Recipient shall take all necessary measures\, including anynecessary water supply tariffs revisions\, to allow the PIE to restore and thereafter maintain financial equilibrium. | Due Date:31-Dec-2012,Finance Agreement :Section II B.3 of Schedule 2 to PA | Description :The PIE shall have recruited an external independent auditorto carry out financial audits. | Due Date :29-Feb-2012,Finance Agreement :Section II B.5 of Schedule 2 to PA | Description :No later than 3 months after effectiveness\, the PIE shall havepurchased and installed an asset management software for the Project. | Due Date :10-Jan-2012,Finance Agreement :Schedule 2\, Section V\, 1 | Description :The Recipient shall\, not later than July 31 of each year\, commencingJuly 31\, 2011\, review the Project Implementing Entity's updated financial projections and take all necessary measures\, includingreadjustment of annual tariff as necessary to permit the restoration or maintenance of the Financial Equilibrium. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS,Finance Agreement :Schedule 2\, Section II\, B.4 | Description :In order to ensure the timely carrying out of the audits referred toin Section II\, B.3 of Schedule 2\, the Recipient shall engage auditors for the purpose not later than five (5) months after theEffective Date in accordance with the provision of Section III of Schedule 2. | Due Date :30-Mar-2017,Finance Agreement :Schedule 2\, Section II\, B.5 | Description :Without limitation to the provisions of paragraph 1 above\, no laterthan three (3) months after the Effective Date\, the Recipient shall ensure that the PCU's accounting software has been adapted forthe Project in a manner satisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :31-Jan-2017,Finance Agreement :Schedule 2\, Section I\, F.2 | Description :The Recipient shall furnish to the Association\, as soon as available\,but in any case not later than November 30 of each year\, the annual work plans and budgets and Safeguard Documents referred to inSection I\, F.1 of Schedule 2 for their review and approval. | Frequency :Yearly

column187: Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 (a) of FA | Description :Subsidiary Agreement has been executed on behalf of the Recipient and theProject Implementation Entity. | Due Date :10-Oct-2011,Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 (b) | Description :Project Implementation Manual and Manual of Procedures have been adapted for theProject. | Due Date :10-Oct-2011,Finance Agreement :Section I A.5 of Schedule 2 | Description :No later than 3 months after effectiveness\, the Recipient hasrecruited a financial management specialist for the Project. | Due Date :10-Jan-2012,Finance Agreement :Section II B.4 of Schedule 2 | Description :To ensure timely carrying out of audits\, the Recipient shall engageauditors no later than 6 months after effectiveness. | Due Date :29-Feb-2012,Finance Agreement :Section II B.5 of Schedule 2 | Description :No later than 3 months after effectiveness\, the Recipient shallensure that the PCU's accounting software has been adapted for the Project. | Due Date :10-Jan-2012,Finance Agreement :Section IV B.1 (b) of Schedule 2 | Description :No withdrawal shall be made under category 2 until the serviceagreement has been entered into. | Due Date :10-Jan-2012,Finance Agreement :Section V (a) of Schedule 2 | Description :The Recipient shall take all necessary measures\, including anynecessary water supply tariffs revisions\, to allow the PIE to restore and thereafter maintain financial equilibrium. | Due Date:31-Dec-2012,Finance Agreement :Section II B.3 of Schedule 2 to PA | Description :The PIE shall have recruited an external independent auditorto carry out financial audits. | Due Date :29-Feb-2012,Finance Agreement :Section II B.5 of Schedule 2 to PA | Description :No later than 3 months after effectiveness\, the PIE shall havepurchased and installed an asset management software for the Project. | Due Date :10-Jan-2012,Finance Agreement :Schedule 2\, Section V\, 1 | Description :The Recipient shall\, not later than July 31 of each year\, commencingJuly 31\, 2011\, review the Project Implementing Entity's updated financial projections and take all necessary measures\, includingreadjustment of annual tariff as necessary to permit the restoration or maintenance of the Financial Equilibrium. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS,Finance Agreement :Schedule 2\, Section II\, B.4 | Description :In order to ensure the timely carrying out of the audits referred toin Section II\, B.3 of Schedule 2\, the Recipient shall engage auditors for the purpose not later than five (5) months after theEffective Date in accordance with the provision of Section III of Schedule 2. | Due Date :30-Mar-2017,Finance Agreement :Schedule 2\, Section II\, B.5 | Description :Without limitation to the provisions of paragraph 1 above\, no laterthan three (3) months after the Effective Date\, the Recipient shall ensure that the PCU's accounting software has been adapted forthe Project in a manner satisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :31-Jan-2017,Finance Agreement :Schedule 2\, Section I\, F.2 | Description :The Recipient shall furnish to the Association\, as soon as available\,but in any case not later than November 30 of each year\, the annual work plans and budgets and Safeguard Documents referred to inSection I\, F.1 of Schedule 2 for their review and approval. | Frequency :Yearly

column187: Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 (a) of FA | Description :Subsidiary Agreement has been executed on behalf of the Recipient and theProject Implementation Entity. | Due Date :10-Oct-2011,Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 (b) | Description :Project Implementation Manual and Manual of Procedures have been adapted for theProject. | Due Date :10-Oct-2011,Finance Agreement :Section I A.5 of Schedule 2 | Description :No later than 3 months after effectiveness\, the Recipient hasrecruited a financial management specialist for the Project. | Due Date :10-Jan-2012,Finance Agreement :Section II B.4 of Schedule 2 | Description :To ensure timely carrying out of audits\, the Recipient shall engageauditors no later than 6 months after effectiveness. | Due Date :29-Feb-2012,Finance Agreement :Section II B.5 of Schedule 2 | Description :No later than 3 months after effectiveness\, the Recipient shallensure that the PCU's accounting software has been adapted for the Project. | Due Date :10-Jan-2012,Finance Agreement :Section IV B.1 (b) of Schedule 2 | Description :No withdrawal shall be made under category 2 until the serviceagreement has been entered into. | Due Date :10-Jan-2012,Finance Agreement :Section V (a) of Schedule 2 | Description :The Recipient shall take all necessary measures\, including anynecessary water supply tariffs revisions\, to allow the PIE to restore and thereafter maintain financial equilibrium. | Due Date:31-Dec-2012,Finance Agreement :Section II B.3 of Schedule 2 to PA | Description :The PIE shall have recruited an external independent auditorto carry out financial audits. | Due Date :29-Feb-2012,Finance Agreement :Section II B.5 of Schedule 2 to PA | Description :No later than 3 months after effectiveness\, the PIE shall havepurchased and installed an asset management software for the Project. | Due Date :10-Jan-2012,Finance Agreement :Schedule 2\, Section V\, 1 | Description :The Recipient shall\, not later than July 31 of each year\, commencingJuly 31\, 2011\, review the Project Implementing Entity's updated financial projections and take all necessary measures\, includingreadjustment of annual tariff as necessary to permit the restoration or maintenance of the Financial Equilibrium. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS,Finance Agreement :Schedule 2\, Section II\, B.4 | Description :In order to ensure the timely carrying out of the audits referred toin Section II\, B.3 of Schedule 2\, the Recipient shall engage auditors for the purpose not later than five (5) months after theEffective Date in accordance with the provision of Section III of Schedule 2. | Due Date :30-Mar-2017,Finance Agreement :Schedule 2\, Section II\, B.5 | Description :Without limitation to the provisions of paragraph 1 above\, no laterthan three (3) months after the Effective Date\, the Recipient shall ensure that the PCU's accounting software has been adapted forthe Project in a manner satisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :31-Jan-2017,Finance Agreement :Schedule 2\, Section I\, F.2 | Description :The Recipient shall furnish to the Association\, as soon as available\,but in any case not later than November 30 of each year\, the annual work plans and budgets and Safeguard Documents referred to inSection I\, F.1 of Schedule 2 for their review and approval. | Frequency :Yearly

column20: The various Apps in the toolbox can assist embassies in their efforts to create a business-enabling environment\, remove trade barriers and in matching local and Dutch business partners\, in order to shape the local implementation of the Dutch agenda for Aid\, Trade and Investment. Matchmaking\, Government to Government assistance\, training of managers and entrepreneurs\, trade missions to and from developing countries\, transfer of knowledge between educational or knowledge institutions such as universities in a given country and in the Netherlands are some examples of these initiatives.
column27: Netherlands Enterprise Agency,Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs,Netherlands Enterprise Agency

Matchmaking\, Government to Government assistance\, training of managers and entrepreneurs\, trade missions to and from developing countries\, transfer of knowledge between educational or knowledge institutions such as universities in a given country and in the Netherlands are some examples of these initiatives.
column27: Netherlands Enterprise Agency,Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs,Netherlands Enterprise Agency

column17: Dutch Risk Reduction Team (DRR Team) Phase 2
column20: The Dutch Risk Reduction Team (DRR Team)\, with a swift response team of experts\, advises governments on how to resolve urgent water issues related to flood risks\, water pollution and water supply\, to prevent disasters or to rebuild after water related disasters. The Netherlands Enterprise Agency administers DRR Team at the request of the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Netherlands Ministry of Infrastructure and Water management.
column27: Netherlands Enterprise Agency,Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs,Netherlands Enterprise Agency
column173: Dutch Risk Reduction Team - Phase 2

column17: Dutch Risk Reduction Team (DRR Team) Phase 2

column27: Netherlands Enterprise Agency,Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs,Netherlands Enterprise Agency
column173: Dutch Risk Reduction Team - Phase 2

column20: The Dutch Surge Support (DSS water) responds to the needs during water related disasters around the globe by deploying excellent experts from the Dutch water sector. With this facility the Netherlands aims to contribute to a better international response to water and sanitation related disasters and assist in building up knowledge in dealing with these emergencies. Netherlands Enterprise Agency administers DRR at the request of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of The Netherlands and the Ministry of Infrastructure and Environment.

column20: The Facility for Infrastructure Development (ORIO) encourages public infrastructure development in upcoming markets and developing countries. ORIO contributes to the development\, construction\, expansion\, operation and maintenance of public infrastructure in these countries. In this way\, ORIO aims to contribute to human development and private sector development. It is untied aid. Netherlands Enterprise Agency administers ORIO at the request of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of The Netherlands.
